result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald D Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting class.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald D Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ronald D Jones in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
*
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 4/22/16.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  The alleged victim has not been brought in to court yet.  Court ordered matter adjourned.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  A body attachment was issued for the alleged victim.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/21/15 in Branch 40.  State put the offer on the record and will hold it open until 9/16/15.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court, defendant Ronald D Jones not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Demand for Speedy Trial was entered on 07-21-2015.
State's request to join cases for trial; no objection by defense counsel.  Court orders cases joined for trial and case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Sarra Kiaie for Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is adjourned to Branch 40, Judge Dallet.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Laverne L or LDL dob 4/1/15

Defendant Ronald D Jones in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Ronald D Jones in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
